known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The current system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation. The system currently requires manual tracking of overtime, unpaid leaves, and does not support automatic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee.

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Daily Wage Formula Between Leave Policy and Payroll
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings overrides the formula in the leave policy for unpaid leave. The system displays a greyed-out formula in the leave policy, indicating that the payroll settings take precedence. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms. Users cannot easily understand why formulas are greyed out or how payroll settings supersede leave policy configurations.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules. Manual alignment is required.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in payroll calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform could not automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change.

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Years
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in an inaccurate gratuity amount. The calculation fails to dynamically adjust for leap years, causing potential underpayment of employee benefits.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing inaccurate service period calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in the EOS gratuity calculator's ability to dynamically handle leap year calculations.

known_issues.title: Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's current daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations.

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation differs slightly from manual calculations due to complex service duration and daily wage formula. Calculation involves splitting service duration into different periods with varying daily rates (21 days per year for first 5 years, 30 days per year after 5 years).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation requires precise service duration tracking and tiered rate application
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential complexity in handling partial years and service duration splits in gratuity calculation

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days and resulting gratuity amount. The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation included 913 days by explicitly counting the leap day.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled
known_issues.gap_statement: Need clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Days Calculation in Gratuity Computation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Platform calculates days worked with a potential extra day (622 vs 623 days), impacting gratuity calculation precision. The system uses a fixed 30-day divisor for daily wage, which may not align with all client calculation preferences.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Days worked calculation shows minor inconsistency in day count
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential precision issue in days worked calculation and daily wage computation method

known_issues.title: Daily Wage Divisor Configuration
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days. The daily wage is divided by a configured number of days (30 vs 31), potentially causing salary calculation differences.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including daily rate divisor configurations | No unified daily wage calculation method across leave salary and salary proration scenarios

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations vary month-to-month due to different working day counts
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months

known_issues.title: Misinterpretation of Working Days Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration calculation depends on work week configuration, which may not align with traditional calendar day expectations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator fails to correctly prorate salary when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. The system only correctly prorates salaries when departure dates are in the past.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The payroll system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in handling dynamic proration scenarios for employees with departure dates differing from payroll processing dates.

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Recalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: Clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes inconsistent between Time Off and Payroll modules. The system cannot recalculate deductions retroactively, causing mismatched salary deduction amounts.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules, preventing automatic recalculation when public holidays are added after leave requests.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for module communication enhancement to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across system configurations.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations, potentially causing confusion about calculation methods.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculated by dividing monthly salary by 30.42 days, not calendar days
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods, especially for leave deductions that might exceed expected monthly salary amounts

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect daily rate remarks for February, showing 31 days instead of 29 days (leap year), despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Global daily rate configuration overrides policy-specific leave calculation settings. System calculates unpaid leave deductions using a global daily rate that takes precedence over individual policy configurations, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is from the wrong month.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display does not match the leave occurrence month
known_issues.gap_statement: Need consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves initially calculated rate at leave request time

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days per Month Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is currently based on a standard 26 working days per month calculation (365 annual days - 52 weekly offs = 313 working days / 12 months = 26.08 working days)
limitations.impact: Manual adjustments required for variations in actual worked days

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formulas
limitations.limitation_statement: For unpaid leave, the daily wage calculator configured in payroll settings automatically overrides the formula in the leave policy.
limitations.impact: Users cannot directly modify the leave policy formula for unpaid leave deductions

limitations.title: Salary Configuration Dependency in Leave Deduction
limitations.limitation_statement: Unpaid leave deduction calculations depend on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect payroll deductions if salary configuration is not created before or simultaneously with leave request

limitations.title: Inflexible Day Counting for Service Period
limitations.limitation_statement: The system defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize leap years in service period calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential undercalculation of employee gratuity benefits

limitations.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Pro-Rated Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations consistently produce slightly lower amounts due to decimal precision errors when computing pro-rated End of Service amounts.
limitations.impact: Employees may receive marginally less compensation during final settlements

limitations.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month, preventing prorated accrual for mid-month departures
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month cannot automatically include current month's leave balance in End of Service (EOS) calculation

limitations.title: Ambiguity in Service Days Counting Methodology
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, specifically around departure date inclusion and leap year day handling
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity calculations

limitations.title: Hardcoded Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of gratuity calculation methodology for clients with different computational preferences

limitations.title: Inflexible Leave Salary Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform's leave salary calculation cannot be easily overridden and follows strictly predefined policy configurations
limitations.impact: Users cannot modify daily wage divisor based on specific month characteristics

limitations.title: Leave Encashment Calculation Method Limitations
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave salary accrual calculations are directly impacted by the selected daily wage calculation method (working days vs. custom days)
limitations.impact: Cumulative leave salary totals can differ month-to-month based on working days configuration

limitations.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
limitations.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors
limitations.impact: Potential calculation discrepancies and manual configuration required to align daily wage methods

limitations.title: Proration Calculation Depends on Work Week Setup
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage proration is calculated based entirely on the configured work week, which can include all 7 days as working days
limitations.impact: Salary calculation may differ from traditional calendar day expectations depending on work week configuration

limitations.title: Limited Proration Date Handling
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration only works correctly when departure dates are in the past, not when they are in the future relative to payroll processing.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for employees with future departure dates

limitations.title: Incomplete Transaction Reconciliation
limitations.limitation_statement: The system does not automatically remove or reconcile payroll deductions when leave requests are deleted or modified.
limitations.impact: Users may experience persistent incorrect payroll deductions that require manual intervention

limitations.title: Daily Wage Calculation Formula
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations and requires precise tracking of working days

limitations.title: Non-Standard Daily Wage Divisor
limitations.limitation_statement: System uses 30.42 days as divisor for daily wage calculation, not standard calendar days
limitations.impact: Deduction amounts may not exactly match expected monthly salary

limitations.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations are based on the actual calendar days in a month, with specific handling for months with varying day counts (e.g., February in leap years).
limitations.impact: Ensures accurate unpaid leave deductions by using the precise number of days in each month

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Formula
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months
